author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...FLASH FLOODING AND GUSTY WINDS CONTINUING OVER EASTERN TEXAS... ...USE CAUTION AFTER THE STORM AS DEADLY HAZARDS REMAIN INCLUDING  DOWNED POWERLINES AND CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING FROM IMPROPER  GENERATOR USE...
summary:
...FLASH FLOODING AND GUSTY WINDS CONTINUING OVER EASTERN TEXAS... ...USE CAUTION AFTER THE STORM AS DEADLY HAZARDS REMAIN INCLUDING  DOWNED POWERLINES AND CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING FROM IMPROPER  GENERATOR USE...
 As of 1:00 PM CDT Mon Jul 8
 the center of Beryl was located near 30.5, -95.5
 with movement NNE at 14 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 987 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 60 mph.
